page.title: 13ARTS AND CRAFTS IN COLYTON
page.content: Drama is represented in the area by the Colyton Theatre Group, who put on an annual play and pantomime in the Feoffees Hall. Colyton also boasts an art gallery where local painters exhibit their work. Leather goods are produced for local use and for tourism in the tannery and saddlery. There is a forge and a blacksmith still working within the town. The East Devon area has long been famous for its lace making industry. Many people in Colyton do this as a hobby and as a cottage industry. Some other crafts practised are macrame, pottery, corndolly making and basket weaving. There is still a working forge and a tannery which uses traditional methods. St.Andrews Church has a choir and occasional festivals are held there.
